intro: Taccarum hasslerianum, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its thick, fleshy leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a perennial herb, often cultivated for its ornamental value. It prefers bright, indirect light and well-draining soil to thrive. Its blooming period usually occurs during the warmer months of the year.
